reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Inter-European Air Forces Academy Mobile Training Team - Brno

description.narrative: This award strives to help nations effectively establish the conditions and capacity for achieving peace, security, and stability. More specifically, this includes This is a two-week course which provides an abbreviated version of the IESOS and IENCOA curriculum. It prepares NCOs and junior officers for more advanced leadership and management responsibilities. Students learn time and stress management, concepts of human behavior, teambuilding, critical thinking, effective communication, and leadership techniques, as well as implementing quality in the workplace. Experiential course activities challenge each student to apply curriculum concepts successfully and to influence group dynamics, cohesion, and effectiveness in a positive manner. By virtue of their international student body, IEAFA courses foster positive relationships between NATO and PfP members, as well as expanding students’ cultural knowledge and learning in a manner consistent with U.S. and NATO objectives. The Inter-European Air Forces Academy web site is at: http://www.usafe.af.mil/Units/Inter-European-Air-Force-Academy/..

To help nations effectively establish the conditions and capacity for achieving peace, security, and stability; and for responding effectively against arising threats to national or international security and stability.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The government of the Czech Republic adopted Czechia as its official short name in July 2016. Czechia continues to show leadership in international affairs, not only through its membership in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) and the European Union, but independently and in other multilateral fora. Czechia has proven to be an important and reliable ally in promoting U.S. interests and values, such as promoting democratic and economic reform, defeating extremism, and promoting global security. Despite the significant costs of supporting and participating in NATO and U.S.-backed coalition military operations, Czechia remains a steadfast ally in NATO. U.S. assistance requested in FY2017 will improve military coordination and continue to build strong security cooperation between the United States and Czechia. U.S. assistance will advance defense reform, build capacity, and strengthen partnerships in the region to more effectively counter Russian aggression and other emerging threats.
